place_of_publication.publication_title: in W. H. Emory, Rep. U. S. Mex. Bound.

treatment.description: Leaves usually 1, 6–30 cm × 3–15 mm. Scape 15–70 cm, minutely scabrous. Flowers: tepals abruptly spreading at base, distinct, yellow with brown midvein, 5–13 mm; filaments parallel to style, 3–10 mm, dilated bases connate into nectariferous cup, cup with basal filament appendages arising from apex, appendages shallowly to strongly 2-cuspidate at apex, cusps linear; anthers 1.5–3 mm; ovary 2–3 mm; style 6 mm; pedicel 0.5–6.5 cm.

key_statement.statement: Cusps of basal filament appendages 1–2 mm, less than 1 / 2 length of filaments, apex acute
Cusps of basal filament appendages 3–3.5 mm, ca. 1 / 2 length of filaments, apex attenuate
